elements.title: The Other Woman
elements.contents:

Discover the best of the web

Today’s essential reads

The Other Woman

Vulture · 16 min

Jennifer Coolidge spins roles as trophy wives and divorcées into comic gold. Now she gets to show what else she can do.

“You Can’t Actually Blow Up the White House”: An Oral History of ‘Independence Day’

The Hollywood Reporter · 30 min

Do We Really Need to Take 10,000 Steps a Day for Our Health?

The New York Times · 3 min

Writing Can Help Us Heal from Trauma

Harvard Business Review · 10 min

Sixty years of climate change warnings: the signs that were missed (and ignored)

The Guardian · 19 min

Fascinating stories

How a Spy Known as the ‘Limping Lady’ Helped the Allies Win WWII

Smithsonian Magazine · 7 min

An electrifying biography explores the remarkable feats of Virginia Hall, a disabled secret agent determined to play her part in the fight against the Nazis.

The 185-year-old Battle That Still Dominates Texas Politics

POLITICO · 14 min

George P. Bush wanted to revamp the Alamo site. Then his own party turned against him.

Roblox, explained

The Verge · 10 min

Everything you wanted to know about one of the biggest apps on the planet.

Why everything feels more expensive right now

Vox · 10 min

Why are prices going up? Used cars, gas, and groceries seem more expensive because they are.

The Russian Family That Cut Itself Off From Civilization for More Than 40 Years

Mental Floss · 6 min

The Lykov family left Russian society under persecution in the 1930s and remained hidden until 1978.

The Sound of My Inbox

The Cut · 18 min

The financial promise of email newsletters has launched countless micropublications — and created a new literary genre.

How Tinned Fish Became The Internet's Newest Obsession

nylon.com · 6 min

What Does Mitch McConnell Do Now?

The Atlantic · 12 min

Who Wins in the Name Game?

The Atlantic · 5 min

How to gain more from your reading

psyche.co · 21 min
Save these stories in a personal library

Use the button to build your personal library of articles right in Pocket. Read them when you’re free in a quiet, calm space.

Start your library

Shohei Ohtani Isn't Babe Ruth—He's Better

Sports Illustrated · 7 min

Ohtani is a once-in-a-century player in a year when we need to be awed, inspired and distracted. Comparing him to the Babe is no longer enough.

Tim Robinson Is Sorry For Yelling

Vulture · 12 min

On I Think You Should Leave, the comedian’s anxieties fuel a vast world of jerks, idiots, and outright assholes.

The Secret to Being Witty, Revealed

Quartz · 5 min

Some of us are just not that funny. But writer James Geary shares how to cultivate wit, turning communication into play.

The Billionaire Playbook: How Sports Owners Use Their Teams to Avoid Millions in Taxes

ProPublica · 24 min

Owners like Steve Ballmer can take the kinds of deductions on team assets — everything from media deals to player contracts — that industrialists take on factory equipment. That helps them pay lower tax rates than players and even stadium workers.

To Expand U.S. Vaccine Access, Consider the Dollar Store

Bloomberg · 7 min

Dollar stores could be key access points for reaching vulnerable populations who have limited access to health care services, and sometimes lack trust in the system.
